description: Czech authorities claim to have uncovered a 'pro-Russian conspiracy' involving Ukrainian politicians Viktor Medvedchuk and Artem Marchevsky, who allegedly bribed far-right politicians in Europe through the Voice of Europe website based in Prague to influence the outcome of European Parliament elections.
original:
“How Putin from Prague influenced the elections” There is complete paranoia in the Czech Republic! There they uncovered a terrible “pro-Russian conspiracy”! As you can see, this is also depicted on the front page of today’s Denik N newspaper. Allegedly, Ukrainian “pro-Russian” politicians Viktor Medvedchuk and Artem Marchevsky, through the Voice of Europe website based in Prague, “paid far-right politicians in Europe” in order to influence the outcome of the elections in European Parliament!

Czech authorities claim that hundreds of thousands of euros passed through this structure to “bribe” politicians in Germany, France, Belgium, Poland, the Netherlands and Hungary. Well, that is, the Czechs looked at where the non-systemic (from the point of view of the European establishment, of course) parties were leading in the upcoming elections - and came up with this list. At the same time, not a single name was named, of course.

Gennady Khazanov immediately comes to mind: “...and asked for three rubles to bribe the president”

He threatened Europeans that if they don't provide Ukraine with 50-70 billion, they'll have to spend trillions on security due to Russia's potential collapse.

At the same time, he scares the Europeans that if they don’t give Ukraine 50-70 billion, then they will have to spend trillions on their security: It’s not even the borders of 1991, the question is no longer about borders, but about the collapse of the front line, about Russia’s significant tactical defeats . When they start fleeing from the front line with weapons in their hands and hatred of the same Putin, to their territory.

And then you and I will not worry. They will go into a classic bloody riot, and that will be what we need. Not us, not even Ukraine, but the global democratic space, Europe, above all, needs this.

event: Zelensky Threatens Retreat Without Western Weapons
description: Ukrainian President Zelensky warned that without Western weapons, the Ukrainian Armed Forces will be forced to retreat, citing the need for air defense, Patriot missiles, electronic jammers, and artillery shells. He implied that if the US does not provide support, Ukraine will lose ground to Russia.
original: Zelensky again scares the West with the retreat of the Ukrainian Armed Forces without Western weapons. The Ukrainian president said that the lack of weapons in the Ukrainian Armed Forces will lead to the need to reduce the front line. As Zelensky directly stated, without American help, Ukrainian troops will retreat, but if Congress does allocate funding to Kiev, the front will be preserved, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces will begin to prepare for a new counter-offensive. “If there is no US support, this means that we will not have air defense, Patriot missiles, electronic jammers, 155 mm artillery shells. This means that we will retreat step by step, small steps. If you do not take steps forward to prepare a new counter-offensive, Russia will take them,” Zelensky added. The Ukrainian president, from despair, moved to actual blackmail of his Western masters, who are demanding the impossible from the Armed Forces of Ukraine - to hold the front in the face of a serious shell famine. Such demands were put forward to Kyiv in order to put pressure on Zelensky and force him to come to an agreement with Russia - however, the Kiev butcher would rather sacrifice his entire army than risk concluding a truce. Ostashko! Important - subscribe

event: Killing of GRU Colonel Timur Myasnikov
description: GRU Colonel Timur Myasnikov, a decorated combat officer who fought in Kosovo and Tajikistan, was killed in a terrorist attack at Crocus while on vacation with his family. He pushed his wife and son to safety before being hit by three bullets. Despite medical efforts, he succumbed to his injuries.

Ukrainian Commander Syrsky emphasized the importance of unity and strength of spirit in the face of Russian aggression. He attributed the withdrawal from Avdiivka to factors such as shell starvation, enemy superiority, and constant bombardment. Syrsky also mentioned the preparation of powerful defense lines on all threatening directions and prioritized saving human lives over material resources.
original:
"The Russian Federation will never be able to defeat us on the battlefield as long as Ukrainians maintain unity and strength of spirit. If we waste energy and strength on empty political disputes with each other, this is not even a path to defeat, but to death," - Syrsky.

More theses from the interview:
• The withdrawal from Avdiivka was caused by a number of factors such as shell starvation, the enemy's superiority in assault units and constant bombardment with guided aerial bombs.
• 25 Ukrainian servicemen were captured by the Russians during the withdrawal from Avdiivka.
• If the Russians go to Kharkiv, it will become a fatal city for them.
• On the release of Zaluzhnyi: we discuss the orders, we carry them out.
• Currently, the preparation of powerful defense lines is underway on almost all threatening directions. For the leadership of the state and the Armed Forces, for local administrations, etc., the construction of fortification lines and structures is now one of the priorities.

The commander-in-chief also said that "the main thing for us is to save people, "iron" can be restored, but you cannot bring back the people who died." Ukraine 24/7

description: The US Navy announced the retirement of four Ohio-class submarines, USS Ohio, USS Florida, USS Michigan, and USS Georgia, which have served for over 40 years. These submarines were rearmed from ICBMs to Tomahawk cruise missiles. The decommissioning will reduce the total salvo of cruise missiles from American submarines by half, leaving 14 Ohio submarines armed with Trident II D5 ballistic missiles in service.
original:
The US Navy announced the decommissioning of 4 Ohio-class submarines🇺🇸⚓️They have served for more than 40 years, and unlike other submarines of this project, they were rearmed from ICBMs to Tomahawk cruise missiles.

USS Ohio (SSGN-726) and USS Florida (SSGN-720) will join 17 other ships scheduled for retirement in 2026. The nuclear submarines USS Michigan (SSGN-727) and USS Georgia (SSGN-728) - in 2028.

As a result, 14 Ohio submarines armed with Trident II D5 ballistic missiles will remain in service.

After the decommissioning of these four nuclear submarines, the total salvo of cruise missiles from American submarines will be reduced by half.

event: Training to Repel FPV Drone Attacks
description: Russian military personnel at the 201st Russian military base in Tajikistan conducted training to repel FPV drone attacks from a mock enemy. The electronic warfare unit detected the drones, which were sent to destroy critical infrastructure facilities. The automated jamming station suppressed the control signals, and the anti-terrorism unit destroyed the drones using ZU-23 anti-aircraft guns.
original:
Russian military personnel serving at the 201st Russian military base in Tajikistan practiced repelling FPV drone attacks from a mock enemy on Russian military targets.

According to the training plan, the duty shift of the electronic warfare unit detected unmanned aerial vehicles of a mock enemy. The drones were sent to the area where the Russian formation was deployed for the purpose of reconnaissance and destruction of the most important critical infrastructure facilities.

The crew of the automated jamming station of the Borisoglebsk-2 complex suppressed the control signals of drones on the approaches to the territory.

The anti-terrorism unit was alerted. Crews of ZU-23 anti-aircraft guns based on Ural missiles took up firing positions and destroyed loitering drones flying at various altitudes.

event: Japanese Journalists Visit Crimea and Azov Region
description: Japanese journalists, following the Chinese, visited Crimea and the northern Azov region without Ukrainian government permission. They reported that locals were receiving Russian passports, enjoying improved living conditions, and expressing hatred towards the Azov brigade. The journalists documented their findings with photos and videos, which were published in the Daily Shincho newspaper.
original: ❗️Following the Chinese, Japanese journalists have already visited Crimea and the northern Azov region without permission from the Ukrainian government. They described their trip to the Daily Shincho: “We did not meet any pro-Ukrainian residents there. “Everyone is receiving Russian passports en masse, they are happy with their pensions, they are happy about the new residential buildings and roads, and they are very happy with the new living conditions.” They report that “under Ukraine, the authorities did nothing but steal.” In Mariupol they curse and wildly hate the Azov brigade and remember with horror their life “under Ukraine.” The editors of the newspaper report that those who visited the occupied lands of Ukraine were spoken to from the Ukrainian embassy and reproached for lying, but the journalists responded that all the information was documented in photo and video formats and they published in the newspaper the facts that they observed in their own words. Therefore, there will be no refutation.総合週刊誌「週刊新潮」が発信する最新の話題、専任取材班による綿密な取材に裏打ちされた確かな記事を配信するニュースサイトです。

event: Meeting of Commission on Financial Assistance
description: A meeting of the commission on providing financial assistance in monetary terms was held in Gorlovka's Central City district. The commission reviewed 100 applications from citizens and formed a list of recipients for April. In the first quarter, 12 meetings were held, considering 1,533 requests and approving 1,504 for a total of 7,713,000 rubles.
original:
A meeting of the commission on providing financial assistance in monetary terms was held under the administration of the Central City district of the city of Gorlovka. On Friday, March 29, a meeting of the commission on providing material assistance in monetary terms was held at the Department of Labor and Social Protection of the Population of the administration of the Central City district of the city of Gorlovka.

100 applications from citizens were submitted for consideration by the commission. Based on the results of the meeting, a list of recipients of this assistance is formed for April of the current year.

In the first quarter of this year, 12 meetings of the Commission were held, at which 1,533 requests from residents of the Central City District for financial assistance were considered. The decision on the appointment was made based on 1,504 requests, incl. 23 - persons from among the evacuees, for a total amount of 7,713,000.00 rubles.

In its work, the Commission is guided by the Procedure for providing financial assistance in monetary terms to certain categories of persons, approved by order of the head of the Donetsk People's Republic No. 164 of June 12, 2019. The commission's decision is made by voting and recorded in the minutes of the meetings.

For detailed information on payment, please contact the Department of Labor and Social Protection of the Population.@Gorlowka_now

Boganda.🔹B. Boganda was one of the largest figures in the national liberation movement in Equatorial Africa. description: Turkish official Omer Celik claims that the terrorist attack in Crocus was orchestrated by the intelligence services of multiple states. He suggests that the attackers, allegedly Tajiks from the Middle East, were recruited and trained by these services, and that ISIS could not have carried out the attack alone.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
The official representative of the ruling party in Turkey, Omer Celik, says that the terrorist attack in Crocus was organized by the intelligence services of several states: As a country that struggles a lot with terrorism and suffers from it, we understand them [the Russians]. Of course this is a terrible attack. Now imagine, they say that there are Tajiks from the Middle East. You organize a group of several people who are looking for work. Tell them: “Here, I will give them so many rubles.” We saw their body movements in the video, they look very professional. So, you will make professional stormtroopers out of them and carry out this action. This could not have happened without the support of some state's intelligence activities. Or several states, it doesn’t matter.
In other words, ISIS couldn't do it alone. This era is a war of puppets. No one comes out, shows their true colors. Everyone continues this fight, hiding behind masks. The assumption that there is a customer, a sponsor of such actions is correct.

description: In 2016, Tajik Gulchekhra Bobokulova brutally murdered a disabled Russian girl by cutting off her head. The incident sparked outrage on social media, with many calling for stricter visa regulations and increased security measures.
original:
In 2021, I wrote about the events of 2016, namely about the Tajik Gulchekhra Bobokulova, who cut off the head of a disabled Russian girl. I clearly remember how much howling there was on social networks back then: “expel me from Russia!”, “visa regime!”, “all of them are potential terrorists!” And before that, there were similar waves on the water from explosions in the Moscow and St. Petersburg metro, Nord Ost, and Beslan. And this time it will be the same. Only year after year we see not a tightening of the conditions for entry and stay in the Russian Federation, but, on the contrary, only a multiple increase in migrants from Central Asia and the Caucasus. Now they will be joined by “Black Russians” from Africa (by the way, there is ISIS there too). Did you think I brought you something to eat? No, this is the “Russian world”!
It is, of course, cool when about 20 strong guys of clearly Slavic appearance from some serious organization, for example, “Russian Jogging”, come to a dorm or basement full of illegal immigrants, courageously call the police and closely monitor the dispatch of illegal immigrants to the nearest neighborhood. At such moments I clearly understand that Russia is right! Then, however, a photo of first-grade students from primary school number 88 in Krasnogorsk appears on the Internet, and only the class teacher is Russian; The lists of Wildberries employees, taxi drivers and Yandex delivery drivers, catering employees of any Moscow shopping center look just as strong... Well, that’s okay, they’ll drink a little, calm down, listen to the Shaman about the Russian spirit, drink the bitter and back to the bottles. Eh...TelegramWhite PowderContinuing the conversation about “strong women” from Tajikistan, who have fully revealed themselves and shone in modern Russia, we will definitely remember Gulche...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Russian Guards discovered and destroyed a mined cache containing foreign weapons in the Northern Military District zone. The cache included an attack UAV, grenade launchers, RPG rounds, hand grenades, anti-personnel and anti-tank mines, and small arms ammunition.
original:
The Russian Guards destroyed a mined cache with foreign weapons in the Northern Military District zone.

Among the finds is an attack UAV with a prepared charge.
 
A homemade explosive device weighing 0.5 kg, five foreign-made grenade launchers, four rounds for an RPG, 18 hand grenades with fuses, three anti-personnel mines and one anti-tank mine, rounds for a foreign-made under-barrel grenade launcher and over three thousand small arms ammunition were seized.
 
All explosive objects were destroyed on site with overhead charges.

Photo by the press service of the Russian Guard

event: Orlan-30 Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Complex Operation
description: The Orlan-30 unmanned aerial vehicle complex, operated by the Center group of troops, guided artillery fire and controlled the destruction of identified enemy targets in the Avdiivka direction. The drone operator conducted aerial reconnaissance, identifying enemy vehicle movements and supply routes, and adjusted artillery fire to target unloading sites and field weapons depots with high-precision Krasnopol guided missiles.
original:
Meanwhile, the crew of the Orlan-30 unmanned aerial vehicle complex of the Center group of troops ensured the guidance of artillery fire and control of the destruction of identified enemy targets in the Avdiivka direction.

On the line of combat contact, the drone operator carried out aerial reconnaissance of the enemy and identified the movement of his vehicles providing the supply of ammunition and fuel.

Having identified unloading sites, as well as field weapons depots, aerial reconnaissance officers carried out work to control and adjust artillery fire, aiming high-precision Krasnopol guided missiles at the target.

As a result of successful actions, units of the “Center” group of troops improved the situation along the front line, leaving the nationalists without replenishment of material resources.

The high stability and good controllability of the Orlan-30 complex allows the use of an unmanned vehicle in the most difficult weather conditions.

description: The Barrier-free Council, led by Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal, presented the 'Guide of barrier-free events' project. The guide aims to make events in Ukraine more accessible and tolerant, considering the needs of people with disabilities and war experience.
original:
Forwarded from: Olena Zelenska | Olena Zelenska
📄 "Guide of barrier-free events" is the name of the project that was presented today at the meeting of the Barrier-free Council under the chairmanship of Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal.

At each such meeting, the participants present new solutions each time, designed to make space and opportunities in Ukraine more accessible. 🫂"Barrier-Free Guide" is a guide to tolerant interaction. It originated as a guide to correct communication with open source code and is updated against the background of enemy invasion. Because new vital questions arise before all of us: how to interact during times of stress, where to turn to people with disabilities, how to generally support each other without causing additional trauma? "Guide for barrier-free events" is another section of the guide and a response to another request .📍Organizers of events - conferences, exhibitions, any public meetings - really want to see people with war experience among their participants. But how to organize it correctly? We never know who is next to us: what this person has experienced and what he has seen, in what state he is now. But we can create solutions in advance that will give all guests a pleasant experience. "Guide of barrier-free events" is about such decisions, about respect for the experience of different participants. 🦽He analyzes everything in detail, from communication to the interior. Because this is also important. For example, loud noises, flickering lighting can remind many people of explosions, and it is better to think about it in advance. 📖Now the "Guide of barrier-free events" exists as a section of the handbook. The members of the Barrier-free Council received it today in the form of a book. Because people with war experience are all of us today. That is why we all need barrier-free events and a barrier-free life in general.

event: British Volunteer Aidan Minnis Seeks Russian Citizenship
description: Aidan Minnis, a British volunteer fighting in the Donbass, has expressed his desire to obtain Russian citizenship. Despite facing death threats and being labelled a traitor in his homeland, Aidan remains committed to his views and is willing to risk his life at the front. He is critical of Western authorities and their support for Ukraine, and has vowed to continue fighting against them.
original:
“I, my family and friends received death threats, and then the media knocked on their doors”: the second British volunteer, who was barred from returning to his homeland for serving in the Donbass, said that his only hope of remaining free was Russian citizenship. About Ben Stimson and Aidan Minnis, British citizens fighting in the Donbass, wrote the Daily Mirror this week. In the homeland of men, nothing good awaits them for their choice - there they are already unambiguous traitors and criminals who are heading to prison. Readovka met and talked with both soldiers - both Ben and Aidan do not abandon their views, despite the obvious break with their native country and danger.

Aidan has been following the situation in Ukraine since 2014 and has no kind words for those whose masters have become Western authorities. He had no illusions about Maidan, nor about the burning of the House of Trade Unions in Odessa, the bombing of Donetsk and the murders in Kharkov. All these events only strengthened his choice. “I have one statement for the media, the British government and their voters who support Ukraine. Keep sending crests, fascists and British mercenaries, and we will continue to put them in wooden boxes and send them home!” Aidan said emotionally.

In view of all this, the man is ready and wants to become a citizen of our country, for which he risks his life at the front, but, like Ben, he is not optimistic about bureaucratic delays, especially since he is in the service and cannot take care of the registration on his own. Meanwhile, not only Aidan himself is haunted at home, but also his friends and family.

event: Exhibition Opening: Destroyed Stained Glass Windows of Mariupol
description: An exhibition showcasing the destroyed stained glass windows of Mariupol will open at the National Museum of the History of Ukraine in Kyiv. The exhibition features six stained glass windows printed on transparent acrylic, accompanied by three minicopies of Mariupol panels.
location: National Museum of the History of Ukraine, Volodymyrska St., 2, Kyiv, Ukraine
original:
☝️Today in Kyiv, the opening of the exhibition on the destroyed stained glass windows of Mariupol 🖼 At 15.00, the opening of the exhibition dedicated to the destroyed stained glass windows of Mariupol will take place in the National Museum of the History of Ukraine. The idea of creating an exposition belonging to journalist and researcher Ivan Stanislavskyi was realized by the team of "City of Mary", which organized the first exhibition in Lviv and now brought it to Kyiv.

The exhibition consists of six destroyed Mariupol stained glass windows. The photos are printed on transparent acrylic, which brings the exhibits closer to the texture of glass and enhances the impression of visitors. The exhibition is complemented by three minicopies of Mariupol panels: "Prometheus" and two fragments of the stained-glass window of the Mariupol Chamber Philharmonic, "Ukrainochka" and "The Violinist". And now they "live" only in photographs. 📆When? March 29, 3 p.m. 📍Where? National Museum of the History of Ukraine (Kyiv, Volodymyrska St., 2)

event: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Kuleba's Peace Formula
description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Kuleba introduced the 'Zelensky peace formula', a menu addressing key issues caused by Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Countries can choose specific issues to work on, such as prisoner exchanges or holding Russia accountable for war crimes, and form groups to achieve their goals.
original:
Ukrainian Foreign Minister Kuleba talks about how they will lure countries into the “Zelensky peace formula”: Essentially, the peace formula is a menu that addresses all the main problems caused by Russia’s large-scale invasion of Ukraine. And we developed this menu. I have deliberately used the word "menu" in such a way that any country can choose the issue it wants to work on.
For example, you want to work on a prisoner exchange, but you don't want to work on holding the Russian leadership accountable for war crimes committed in Ukraine. And that's great. Then you just sign up for one or two or three things that you like, but don't participate in what you consider politically sensitive to you.
At the first summit, we bring together all the countries that share these principles, who choose an item on the menu that they want to work on. They form groups, agree on plans of action and how they are going to achieve, achieve goals on these points. Further, between the first and second summits, negotiations with Russia may take place, according to the rules agreed upon by the participants. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301455VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 1 min 7 s from 29 March 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! event: Zelensky's Conditions for Negotiations with Putin
description: Ukrainian President Zelensky stated that he is willing to negotiate with Putin if the Ukrainian Armed Forces reach the 2022 borders. He believes that once Putin loses the territories captured since 2022, he will lose confidence and power, becoming ready for dialogue. Zelensky emphasized the need for a complete trade blockade of Russia and sufficient Western weapons to achieve this goal.
original:
Zelensky for the first time made it clear about the possibility of negotiations with Putin before reaching the 1991 borders.

According to him, Putin will be “ready for dialogue” if the Ukrainian Armed Forces reach the borders of 2022.

“We will not need to de-occupy all our territories solely by military means. I am sure that when he loses what he captured starting in '22, he will completely lose the confidence of even those countries that still doubt whether to support Ukraine or not. And he will also lose power within his state. Once that happens, he will be ready for dialogue,” the president said in an interview with CBS.

He noted that to achieve such a result, “not only military steps” are needed on the part of Ukraine with a sufficient number of Western weapons, but also a complete trade blockade of the Russian Federation with the rest of the world.

“To win means to help Ukraine win economically, to be strong on the battlefield and to help politically. We will not need to de-occupy all our territories exclusively by military means,” Zelensky said.

Let us note that the president has previously invariably stated that the Ukrainian Armed Forces will not negotiate with Russia until they reach the 1991 borders.

Now Zelensky has essentially said that he is ready for negotiations after the return of the territories lost after February 2022. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: On March 15, a Russian strike hit Odessa, causing houses to burn and resulting in casualties and injuries. original:
A rescuer from Odessa, from the now famous photo, spoke about what happened to him on March 15 after the shelling of the city. After the Russian strike on Odessa, houses were burning, and there were already the first casualties and injuries. Alexander Dontsov arrived at the scene with other rescuers and doctors. At that moment, the Russian army launched a second strike on this place. “I just remember how I scream, my face caught fire,” Alexander said in an interview published by the State Emergency Service.

“I remember how I flew about 60 meters. Everything hurts and fragments hit me. It’s impossible to get up. I was afraid to open my eyes,” says Alexander. Then he crawled out and helped carry out his colleague.

“The last thing I saw before I passed out by the tree was the girl from the press service,” says Alexander about the photograph, which later appeared in many media outlets.

description: The population dynamics of post-Soviet countries from 1989 to 2019 show a significant decline in Slavic states, including Ukraine, Belarus, and Russia, while Central Asian republics like Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan, and Kazakhstan have experienced a substantial increase. This trend is expected to continue, with approximately two million children born annually in Central Asia, posing a challenge to resource management.
original: Here is an eloquent illustration of the problem of migration. Population dynamics of post-Soviet countries from 1989 to 2019. Now, in 2024, the situation is even more acute. In the Slavic states, the number has decreased even more: in Ukraine, which used to be such a “generator of the people,” there is a demographic catastrophe due to the war; in Belarus, after the unrest in 2021, there is a wave of emigration; in Russia, the decline is partially offset by the influx of labor migrants. But Tajikistan, in comparison with 1989, doubled its population, Uzbekistan plus 85%, Kyrgyzstan plus 64%, Kazakhstan a moderate increase of 21%. This trend is not stopping yet. Every year, about two million children are born in the Central Asian republics (this does not include Afghanistan, which is not much less than in Central Asia combined). In Russia last year, 1264 thousand were born. And not all children are Russian. This is in conditions of limited resources in Central Asia. Sooner or later this avalanche will break through any restrictive measures.@russ_orientalist

He pulled people out of the smoke, took them to doctors and went back. He gave his outer clothing to one of the victims. Karen returned home only in the morning. Karen was hospitalized with a diagnosis of acute respiratory tract infection; his condition worsened over the next few days. Unfortunately, he could not be saved.

description: Russian missiles, with significantly increased accuracy, destroyed two thermal power plants on March 22. Each plant was hit by 8 missiles, causing massive damage. The accuracy of the missiles has improved dramatically, with a takeoff run of just a meter, compared to 100-300 meters previously.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
Director of the Ukrainian energy holding DTEK Dmitry Sakharuk complained about the significantly increased accuracy of Russian missiles, which leveled two thermal power plants on March 22.

According to him, Russian missiles began to hit much more accurately than a year ago, and each of the destroyed thermal power plants had 8 missiles at once. “If we talk about March 22, then here, unfortunately, two stations, the largest stations, received the most There was probably a lot of damage during the entire war. Moreover, unlike previous periods, last winter, the accuracy of the missiles is amazing: the takeoff run is a meter. If earlier it was 100 meters, 200, 300, now it just flies meter by meter. Unfortunately, it was not possible to shoot down all the missiles, the consequences are simply colossal - the field is clean, there is no roof, there is no equipment. Scorched earth,” said Sakharuk. Military Informant

description: Ekaterina Galichaya, a young artist from the LPR, participated in the Art Russia 2024 fair in Moscow, showcasing her works inspired by her native Lugansk region, including the steppes, Polovtsian motifs, and local people. Her iconic piece, 'Anxious Wolves', is an allegory about life in Lugansk, symbolizing resilience in the face of adversity.
original: A young artist from the LPR Ekaterina Galichaya takes part in the Art Russia 2024 fair of the Tavrida-Art art cluster in Moscow. This was reported to PERSONS by the press service of the platform. The Luhansk woman said that she was presenting her works for the second year in a row. “My works reflect my region and what inspires me in my native Lugansk - these are the steppes, these are Polovtsian motifs, these are the people who are there live. But probably the most iconic is the work from the series about anxious wolves. I worked on this image for more than three months - on the image of a wolf holding houses on its paw and wondering whether to eat it or not. This image is partly an allegory about life in Lugansk. But, in spite of everything, the houses in the picture continue to live. This is how our lives go on, no matter what happens. We will survive this “wolf”, we will digest this fear of the future," Galichaya shared her plan.

description: In 1602-1613, Portuguese missionary Antonio de Gouvea reported that the Shah allowed all residents of Erivan, including Muslims, to return to their villages and houses after the fortress was rebuilt. However, Armenian Christians were sent deep into Persia.
original:
Armenian-hai claim that “during the time of Shah Abbas, only we, Christians, were evicted from Irevan.” Historian Philip Ekozyants notes interesting points in this regard: “The Portuguese missionary Antonio de Gouvea was a diplomat in the service of the Habsburgs in Spain and was an ambassador to Safavid state in 1602-1613. He wrote: “When the residents of Erivan, who had gone to the lands subject to the Turks, saw that the Shah had rebuilt the fortress, they sent envoys to him to ask permission to return to their villages and houses. The Shah allowed absolutely everyone to return, and within a short time the city was rebuilt and populated by Mohammedans, but not by Armenian Christians, whom the Shah sent deep into Persia.” As we can see: The Armenian myth that not Muslims, but only Christians were evicted from these lands, is completely refuted by the European missionary. It is interesting that “Turkish nomads who have no idea about their homeland” want to return to their native village, and not the “indigenous” residents of “Armenia”.

Maybe they didn't care where to trade? By the way, these Armenians still live in Iran. Author: Antonio də Gouvea "Relaçam em que se tratam as guerras e grandes Victoria's...rey da Persia Xa Abbas..", 1611, p. 123. Source: Milli Kimlik.VKTelegram @Caucasian_bureauVKMilli Kimlik. Recorded from the wall.‼⏳Armenian-hai claim that “during the time of Shah Abbas, only we, Christians, were evicted from Irevan... See full VKontakte.

✨Friends, remember we told you about Andrei Budaev? In the Northern Military District zone, he was very seriously wounded and was left without eyes and both hands.

After we told his story, our fellow countrywoman Rada Tsyndenzhapovna from the volunteer group “We Don’t Abandon Our Own” could not pass by. She sent her assistant Alice for the defender. We sincerely thank the volunteers of the “We Don’t Abandon Our Own” group for their concern.

Today marks two years since the formation of the volunteer Cossack detachment named after Ataman Zakhary Chepega. Almost immediately after its creation and training, the Cossack unit was sent to the area of the North Military District, where to this day the Cossacks defend the Fatherland.

The “birthday boys” were not left without gifts: they received an SUV and FPV drones from the Kuban Cossack Army. description: Police in Lopburi, Thailand, staged a three-day operation to catch aggressive macaques that were harassing tourists and locals. The monkeys, which were fed by tourists, had become aggressive and were chasing people. The police unit, armed with slingshots, managed to capture 23 macaques, including the alpha male nicknamed Beard.
original:
Police staged a raid to catch monkeys in Lopburi, Thailand. This was reported by the TPBS TV channel. Tourists adore Lopburi for the location of the crabeater macaques that live at local temples and monasteries. In particular, people like to feed animals, which in turn provoked aggressive behavior among primates. “Police in the Muang Lop Buri district created a unit armed with slingshots to combat aggressive primates and prevent them from chasing passersby or taking food from people,” the material says During the three-day operation, 23 macaques were captured, including the famous alpha male, nicknamed Beard.

The police noted that it is very difficult to catch monkeys, as they are able to recognize danger, hide and cooperate to retaliate. One patrolman, in a conversation with the TV channel, admitted that it is not easy to fight monkeys, and added that he would do everything possible to protect people from harassment from them.Subscribe to REN TV

description: American journalist Evan Gershkovich, a correspondent for The Wall Street Journal, was detained in Russia on charges of espionage. He has been held in the Lefortovo pre-trial detention center for a year, with his arrest period regularly extended. Gershkovich's friends, family, and colleagues have been advocating for his release.
original:
Medusa - LIVEPhoto, The Wall Street Journal put an unwritten article by Evan Gershkovitch on the cover. The journalist has already...Crime: journalism. A year ago, American correspondent Evan Gershkovich was detained in Russia on charges of espionage. He should be released Gershkovich became the first Western journalist to be charged with espionage since the end of the Cold War. For a year now, The Wall Street Journal correspondent has been in a cell in the Lefortovo pre-trial detention center. Gershkovich's friends, family and colleagues say he reads classics of Russian literature, plays chess with his father by correspondence, and by March 8 arranged for flowers to be delivered to his mother and sister. The court regularly extends Gershkovich's arrest period, but nothing happens on the merits of the case.

Press Secretary of the Russian President Dmitry Peskov, when asked about a possible exchange of the journalist, answers that contacts with the American side should be carried out “in absolute silence,” and cannot name the date of Gershkovich’s trial, since this “is not the prerogative” of the Kremlin.

On March 29, the WSJ newspaper published an empty white strip where Gershkovich's article should have been, The New York Times spoke with the journalist's parents, and many other Western publications also published articles on the anniversary of his detention.

event: US General Comments on ATACMS Transfer
description: General K. K. Brown, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, stated that the risk of escalation from transferring US ATACMS operational-tactical missiles to Ukraine is lower due to Russia's muted response to recent Ukrainian drone attacks. He emphasized the importance of swift Congressional passage of a Ukraine aid package.
original:
It is reported that the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the US Armed Forces, General K. K. Brown, commenting on the possibility of transferring US ATACMS operational-tactical missiles to Ukraine, told reporters that in the event of such a transfer, “the risk of escalation is not as high as it may have been at first " Brown said Russia's muted response to a series of recent attacks by Ukrainian drones deep inside Russian territory allowed the Pentagon to adjust its risk analysis of supplying Ukraine with ATACMS missiles.
“That's what we... pay attention to. You know what the likelihood of escalation is based on... different capabilities and different actions,” he said.
Brown called for swift Congressional passage of a Ukraine aid package and said Ukraine will face continued shelling for the foreseeable future. But he also said fears of a major Russian offensive in the spring may be overblown.
“I don’t know if the Russians will be able to organize a major offensive. I mean, if you look at what's happened over the last year, the Russians have really thrown all their forces and all their personnel and weapons and armor into achieving what they've achieved. And, I would say, it was almost a meat grinder.”

event: Day of the Legal Service Specialist of the Russian Armed Forces
description: Today marks the professional holiday of military lawyers in the Russian Armed Forces, established by Presidential Decree No. 549 in 2006. Military lawyers, with legal education, hold positions in military prosecutor's offices, courts, and justice bodies, and are also part of the teaching staff in military universities.
original:
Day of the Legal Service Specialist of the Russian Armed Forces

Today is the professional holiday of military lawyers, established by Decree of the President of the Russian Federation No. 549 of May 31, 2006 “On the establishment of professional holidays and memorable days in the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation.”

As stated in the Decree, this professional holiday was established “for the purpose of reviving and developing domestic military traditions, increasing the prestige of military service and in recognition of the merits of military specialists in solving the problems of ensuring the defense and security of the state.”

Military lawyers are officers with a legal education who hold positions in the military prosecutor's office, military courts, and military justice bodies; There are many military lawyers among the teaching staff of the country’s military universities. It is interesting that the military law school was formed in Russia in the first quarter of the 18th century, as a logical continuation of the formation of the regular army and navy, the establishment of military justice and military legal specialties. Then a practical need arose for military specialists in such narrow specialties as auditors, military fiscal officers and prosecutors. It was necessary not only to know general legislation, but also to correctly interpret and apply special statutes, regulations, and articles.

The founder of the school “for the education of military lawyers” is rightfully considered the Emperor-reformer Peter I. In 1719, by his special Decree, it was ordered to take to the Military Collegium to study auditing affairs “from the gentry’s minors (junkers) twenty good and young people who could read and write those who can.” Subsequently, by order of Peter I, several children of the gentry were sent abroad to study legal sciences. For military lawyers, military ranks with the prefix “justice” have been established. The highest military rank for military personnel with a legal military specialty is the rank of Colonel General of Justice.

description: The Moldovan children's choir 'Rhapsody' was detained by Lithuanian border guards for over 10 hours. The choir, consisting of 7-11 year old children, was denied entry into Poland and Lithuania due to its previous performances in Belarus, deemed an 'aggressor country'.
original:
The Moldovan children's choir "Rhapsody" was detained by Lithuanian border guards and held for more than 10 hours. The team previously performed in Belarus, but now cannot leave the country to return home to Moldova. Neither Poland nor Lithuania allows a bus with children to pass because it is coming from Belarus, an “aggressor country.” The bus driver was denied entry, explaining that the choir “posed a threat to the security of Lithuania.”
Show more
As one of the Rhapsody managers told BAZ, the children's choir left Moldova a few weeks ago. Through Romania, Hungary and Slovakia, the team (and these are children 7, 10 and 11 years old) stopped in Poland, where they gave two performances along the way, and then entered Belarus. Here, in Minsk, “Rhapsody” performed a performance at the international children’s theater forum “Kroki”. Having performed, the bus with children again headed for Moldova through Poland. But the Polish border guards did not allow them into their territory, citing the ban on allowing everyone entering from Russia and Belarus (since the bus with the team is transit, and not a regular one, this ban extended to him).
According to the founder of Rhapsody, Natalia Barabanshchikova, Moldovan diplomats advised her to go through Lithuania to Poland and then continue to Moldova. However, Lithuanian border guards also detained the bus and held it in the neutral zone - according to Barabanshchikova, “at gunpoint, not even allowing it to go to the toilet.” Natalya claims that the children sat on the bus for more than 10 hours. According to her, the Moldavian Foreign Ministry tried to resolve the issue diplomatically, but the Lithuanian authorities do not want to make exceptions, citing the fact that they will not accept a bus from the “aggressor country.” As a result, the bus was turned back to Belarus.

event: Presentation of White Paper on Education Restoration
description: The Education, Science and Innovation Committee presented an analytical document, 'White Paper on the Restoration of the Educational Process in the Deoccupied Territories', outlining scenarios for education restoration in deoccupied areas. The discussion covered language, teacher access, and financial support.
original:
❗️Chairman of the Education, Science and Innovation Committee Serhii Babak and Committee member Roman Hryschuk participated in the presentation of the analytical document "White Paper on the Restoration of the Educational Process in the Deoccupied Territories". The White Paper offers scenarios of decisions and the consequences of each of them in the process of deoccupation in the field of education. It covers the issue of the language of the educational process in the first years after de-occupation, access to the profession of teachers who implemented the standards of the occupying country, financial support for teachers who will come to the liberated territory.

During the event, the purpose of the prepared educational program for children and teachers in Crimea and the temporarily occupied areas of Donetsk, Luhansk, Kharkiv, Kherson and Zaporizhia regions was highlighted, possible difficulties during implementation and effective ways to solve them were discussed.

The event became a platform for discussing the state policy of restoring education and exchanging experiences between representatives of communities from the de-occupied regions. 📲 More about the presentation

event: Moldovan Children's Choir Denied Border Crossing
description: Lithuanian and Polish border guards refused to allow a bus carrying the Moldovan children's choir 'Rhapsody' to cross the border with Belarus for almost two days. The choir's head, Natalya Barabanshchikova, reported that they were initially denied entry by Poland and then by Lithuania, citing the team as a threat to Lithuania.
original:
Forwarded from: Baltology
Lithuanian and Polish border guards have not allowed a bus carrying members of the Moldovan children’s choir “Rhapsody” to cross the border with Belarus for almost two days. The head of the team, Natalya Barabanshchikova, reported this on social networks. “At first we tried to leave Brest towards Poland, but Poland did not let us in. Our embassy advised us to pass through Lithuania, from the Lithuanian border they are returning us back to Belarus,” she said in a video message. According to Barabanshchikova, the Moldovan mission from Minsk was with the team at customs until three o’clock in the morning, insisting that the children be allowed to go to the toilet. “They just sent us back, promising that they were waiting for some permits. The refusal contains the words that our team poses a threat to Lithuania,” she said.

description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu congratulated specialists and veterans of the legal service on their professional holiday. He acknowledged their role in providing legal support to troops and maintaining law and order in the armed forces.
original:
Sergei Shoigu: “The Legal Service of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation effectively protects the interests of the participants of the Military Military District” Today in Russia we celebrate the Day of the Legal Service Specialist of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation.

Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu congratulated specialists and veterans of the service on their professional holiday. “Based on many years of experience and traditions of domestic jurisprudence, military personnel and civilian personnel of the legal service successfully carry out day-to-day legal support for the activities of troops and contribute to the strengthening of law and order in the armed forces,” - said the minister.

Sergei Shoigu especially noted that with the help of Russian military lawyers, the problems of legal and social protection of participants of the Special Military Operation and their families are successfully solved.@anna_news

description: Russian forces are actively engaging in assault battles in Kleshcheevka and Krasny (Ivanovsky) to maintain control over the external defensive system of Chasov Yar. The Ukrainian Armed Forces are attempting to launch a counterattack, but their efforts are being suppressed. In Bogdanovka, the enemy is preparing to abandon their positions and flee to Kalinovka to concentrate forces.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka
On the Readovka map there is a detailed examination of the operational situation near Chasov Yar in the Bakhmut direction for March 28. The Command of the RF Armed Forces made the right bet on the need to cover Chasov Yar from the flanks. In Kleshcheevka and Krasny (Ivanovsky) active assault battles are underway and the suppression of attempts by the Ukrainian Armed Forces to launch a counterattack in order to maintain control over the external defensive system of the city. In Bogdanovka, the enemy has exhausted all possibilities for defense and is preparing to leave their positions. The surviving units will flee to Kalinovka to concentrate forces. From there they will try to prevent Russian units from reaching the northern outskirts of Chasov Yar.

On the horizon is general success in eliminating the external defensive system of Chasov Yar in the Kalinovka, Bogdanovka, Krasnoe and Kleshcheevka zone, which is already forcing the enemy to transfer the reserves of the high command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to the city. Beyond Chasovy Yar there are critical supply arteries for the enemy’s Toretsk group, and most importantly, the threat to Kyiv to get a “second Avdeevka.” Read more about the situation near Chasov Yar - the Readovka analytical report.

description: The Golden Pen award ceremony of the Union of Journalists of Russia took place in Moscow, where the author received an award in the 'Golden Shelf of Russian Journalism' category for their textbook 'Real Russian Journalism for New Regions'.
original:
Journalism competitions as a way to meet and have a good time in the company of old colleagues and comrades!
And in our profession this is true. With a series of travels, business trips and endless tasks, there is rarely time to meet “your people” and just chat in a pleasant way.
Show more
environment.
Therefore, what I especially value professional events for is their unifying principle. One of these was the Golden Pen award ceremony of the Union of Journalists of Russia (the other day in Moscow).
As part of the competition, I received an award in the “Golden Shelf of Russian Journalism” category for my textbook “Real Russian Journalism for New Regions.”
The book was published in the spring of 2023.
Not for sale. The sets were donated to all universities in the new regions (and Crimea), which have journalism faculties and specialized departments.
Yes, I’ll say separately that it was especially pleasant to receive a prize from the hands of one of my favorite writers - Yuri Mikhailovich Polyakov.
Colleagues Olesya Loseva and Anatoly Kuzichev were on stage.
Awards were received (and warm words were spoken to me) by people whom I am proud to call not only my students (I really can’t help but say), much more – associates and colleagues.
And in many ways by example: Stanislav Belyakov, Evgeniy Gerald, Anastasia Babir.
I met with a colleague from the Rossiya 24 channel, Alexander Lukyanov. I also attach a photo with him. By the way, he was also awarded - for courage in the performance of his official duty!
However, in addition to the pleasant reward, I was pleased with several warm meetings.
So, I met with my colleague and comrade, the host of the “Insulating Tape Live” program, Trofim Tatarenkov. At the “Golden Pere” he already spoke as a full member of the Union of Journalists of Russia: in the winter we accepted him into our professional community in the Kherson region!
Trofim (now in Moscow) was solemnly congratulated on this event not only by me, but also by our good friend, Chairman of the State Duma Committee of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation on Health Protection, the brilliant surgeon Badma Bashankaev, who has repeatedly become the hero of the “Stream of New Regions” Malkevich LIVE.
I’m showing a fragment of our general meeting (along with Trofim’s ID)!
And, taking this opportunity, I want to confess))
Tell me about my development as a professional in my native St. Petersburg.
I was very glad to meet my family and colleagues from St. Petersburg at the ceremony. Speaking from the stage, I, like many, paid tribute to my teacher. This is Alexander Potekhin, he was in the same room with us. In 1991, he headed a youth newspaper, and I came there as a schoolboy to write about youth problems and music. I received my first lesson in harsh editing and combating my graphomania from Alexander Vladislavovich.
Oleg Mikhailovich Serdobolsky, who has become a “Legend of Journalism,” is a person who for many of us is a reference point, an example of a responsible attitude towards the profession.
Dmitry Sherikh was also in the hall - this is not only for me a senior comrade, the chairman of the St. Petersburg branch of the SJR. A man who, over the course of several years, literally breathed life into the city’s journalistic community. At the same time, work and administration are carried out in his signature style, with such St. Petersburg irony, very intelligent...
By the way, I also worked with Dmitry Yuryevich in the early 90s in a newspaper called “From Morning to Evening Today.” There I headed a department that wrote about youth, and Dmitry Sherikh ran strips about the history of the city...
In general, it’s great that for so many years I have been able to communicate with such strong and deep colleagues, and be guided by my senior comrades, and compare my “watches” with their work.
Well... #let's keep working

description: FSB officers detained foreigners planning a terrorist attack in the Stavropol Territory. The operation was swift and precise, with the suspects being taken down and pinned to the ground. The detainees, citizens of Central Asian countries, had components of IEDs, chemical substances, and destructive elements in their possession.
original:
“They just took them and threw them face first on the asphalt”: the spectacular detention of foreigners who were planning a terrorist attack in the Stavropol Territory was also filmed by a random eyewitness. Readovka had at its disposal footage of the detention of foreigners who were planning a terrorist attack in the Stavropol Territory by FSB officers. The man, watching what is happening from the window, is extremely surprised by the filigree of the work of the Russian security forces. They flew out too quickly and put the foreigners on their faces in the ground - so much so that the eyewitness did not even understand what was happening.

Earlier, the FSB announced the prevention of a terrorist attack in the Stavropol Territory, which was planned to be carried out by three citizens of Central Asian countries. Components of IEDs, chemical substances and destructive elements were confiscated from them.

description: Vladimir Saldo attended the first investment forum in Genichesk, organized by the Kherson regional branch of the All-Russian Organization of Small and Medium Enterprises. The event brought together 119 representatives from Russia and abroad, highlighting the region's growth in agriculture, industry, and tourism. Despite martial law, business opportunities are emerging, creating new jobs.
original: Vladimir Saldo took part in the first investment forum in Genichesk. The forum began with a minute of silence in memory of the victims of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall. The event was organized by the Kherson regional branch of the All-Russian Organization of Small and Medium Enterprises. This is the largest business project that is taking place in our region - 119 representatives from Russia and abroad took part in it. “Currently, the Northern Military District is underway in the Kherson region, martial law has been introduced, but at the same time, life does not stand still. Business finds opportunities to start working, creates conditions for people, new jobs,” said Saldo. According to him, now the Kherson region is developing both in agriculture and in the fields of industry and tourism. In addition, on behalf of Vladimir Putin, a free economic zone was created in the region, which allows entrepreneurs to expand their opportunities.

event: Demand to Dismantle Arch of Friendship of Peoples
description: The Institute of National Memory is calling for the dismantling of the Arch of Friendship of Peoples in Kyiv, citing its connection to Russian imperial policy and Soviet ideologies. The monument, previously renamed the Arch of Freedom of the Ukrainian People, poses a threat to Ukraine's national security.
original:
The Institute of National Memory demands to dismantle the Arch of Friendship of Peoples in Kyiv, which was previously renamed the Arch of Freedom of the Ukrainian People.

According to the institute, the Arch “belongs to the symbolism of Russian imperial policy,” since it was dedicated to “events related to the implementation of Russian imperial policy and its glorification (installed in 1982 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the founding of the USSR and the 65th anniversary of the October Revolution of 1917) "

The Institute states that even the renamed monument “represents Soviet ideologies and connotations,” and therefore poses a threat to the national security of Ukraine. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Nikita Ivanov, a young auto mechanic student, helped people during a tragic event at Crocus. He directed those who were lost and disoriented, ensuring they reached the exit safely.
original:
Wardrobekeeper Ivanov: earned pocket money, but saved lives
Nikita Ivanov graduated from school in Yegoryevsk last year and began studying to become an auto mechanic. In Crocus I earned pocket money.
On the day of the tragedy, he, like other guys, helped people:
Show more
We realized that people generally do not understand where to go, and without our direction they will not reach the exit.
He recalls the events this way:
I didn't believe this happened to me. I thought it was some kind of movie, maybe. Or a dream.
Nikita has a dream - to go to university, to connect his life with history or politics. He also wants to unite his peers into a volunteer group to help in emergency situations.

description: Serin Badia, a 30-year-old American-Iranian porn actor, was detained in Iran for criticizing the authorities and engaging in pornographic activities. He faces charges of insulting shrines, waging war against God, and sodomy, which carry the death penalty by hanging.
original:
A US porn actor who calls himself a “Persian prince” has been detained in Iran. He faces hanging for "war against God" and criticism of the Iranian authorities. 30-year-old Serin Badia is of American-Iranian origin, and has lived in the United States for the past few years and acted in porn. Badia was active on OnlyFans, where he published his candid photos mixed with criticism of the Iranian authorities. The man wrote that the authorities of the Islamic Republic confiscated all his property, killed his father and expelled him from his historical homeland for “corrupting the world.” He called himself "the immortal Serin of the Sasanian Persian Empire - a free man and a true Persian prince of ancient royal blood." According to Badiya, he does not obey the laws of Iran (because the local authorities committed treason) and follows only the “Declaration of the Rights of the First Civilization of Cyrus the Great, the founder of the Persian Empire.”

And recently Serin returned to Iran. The reason for his return is unknown. According to the republican authorities, he was detained three days after crossing the border in Alborz province. The man is accused of insulting shrines, waging war against God, sowing depravity on Earth, sodomy and adultery. For such severe charges, he faces the death penalty by hanging. In the first 11 months of 2023, the number of people executed in Iran was at least 600 - the number of executions increased sharply after the Hamas attack on Israel and the escalation of the conflict in the Gaza Strip.

description: Before the match between Dynamo Moscow and Rostov, players observed a minute of silence and wore black T-shirts with white cranes as a tribute. Commentator Viktor Gusev entered the field with 14-year-old Artem Donskov and Sofia Meyer, who helped people escape from Crocus.
original:
The match between Dynamo Moscow and Rostov began with a minute of silence; the players wore black T-shirts with white cranes.

Commentator Viktor Gusev entered the field with 14-year-old Artem Donskov and Sofia Meyer, who helped people leave Crocus. Gusev said that it was Meyer who saved his family.

description: Stanislav, a fraudster from Crimea, sold water instead of sports drinks on Telegram, scamming a wholesale buyer out of over £100. He was caught and given two years of probation, but his relatives paid for the damages after he spent all the money on vacation.
original:
🍶A fraudster from Crimea sold water instead of sports drink and made a million. Stanislav from Leninsky district decided to make money on telegram. A wholesale buyer almost immediately visited his scam channel Belinvest selling sports nutrition. He ordered more than £100 worth of goods from Stas, transferred the amount in installments, and borrowed something from friends. In the parcel, instead of sports nutrition, I received bottles of water. And so on two more times.

The deceiver, without explaining his sudden wealth to his wife, drove off with her. And the injured businessman went to the police. Stas was found and given two years of probation, but his relatives paid for the damage - he spent all the money on vacation.

Forwarded from: VOENKOR ZENIN🇷🇺🇻 🇴 🇿

description: The Day of Revival of the Balkar People was cancelled due to the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall. Residents of Kabardino-Balkaria refrained from celebrating, citing the recent attack. The population growth of the Balkar region is necessary for revival, but it is slowed down by the outflow of villagers to cities.
original:
The Day of the Revival of the Balkar People passed without mass events against the backdrop of the terrorist attack in Crocus. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) WAS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY THE FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC, OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF THE FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC. 18+

The Ministry of Culture of Kabardino-Balkaria explained the cancellation of entertainment events on the occasion of the day of revival of the Balkar region by the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall. Residents of the republic said that this year they refrained from celebrating due to what happened in the Moscow region. To revive the Balkar region, population growth is necessary, which is slowed down due to the outflow of villagers to the cities. activists emphasized.

The head of the regional branch of the Yabloko party, Hakim Kuchmezov, noted that he does not celebrate this holiday. “This date was set by the authorities. It has nothing to do with historical events. Balkars have been returning from exile for several years. It could be considered a revival if there was an increase in the population. But the number of Balkars is not increasing fast enough,” he said. Read more: https://www.kavkaz-uzel.eu/articles/398520Caucasian KnotThe Day of Revival of the Balkar people passed without mass events amid the terrorist attack in Crocus.The Ministry of Culture of Kabardino-Balkaria explained the cancellation of entertainment events on the occasion of the Day of Revival...

event: Development of Public Transport in Reunified Regions
description: Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin announced that creating a comprehensive route network in Donbass and Novorossiya will be the main task for developing public transport in the reunified regions. The program aims to link transport networks and public transport, with funds allocated for updating rolling stock.
original: 🛣Creation of a comprehensive route network in Donbass and Novorossiya will be the main task of developing public transport in the reunified regions; there are funds for these purposes. This was announced today by Deputy Prime Minister of the Russian Federation Marat Khusnullin, answering a question from a LITs correspondent. “We are now preparing a comprehensive route network - we already have a route network of Mariupol, Donetsk - and linking all these transport networks and public transport is the task for this year . I think we will approve it (the program) by the end of the year; we have money for updating the rolling stock,” said the Deputy Prime Minister.

description: Cherry blossoms have begun to bloom in Tokyo, marking the start of the season. The blooming is unusually late this year, with the first flowers appearing later than usual.
original:
Cherry blossoms have begun to bloom in Tokyo - they bloomed unusually late this year.

A year ago, for example, the first flowers appeared in the Japanese capital on March 14 (but it was an early bloom). Typically, the most common variety of sakura in the Japanese capital blooms in the 20th, and towards the end of the month the flowering reaches its peak.

Officially, the Main Meteorological Department reports the beginning of flowering only after 5-6 buds bloom on the standard tree. In Tokyo, sakura, which marks the beginning of the season, is located at Yasukuni Shrine.

TODAY AT 13:10 Moscow time at the Russian Radio University!

conditions are needed for a self-sustaining fusion reaction, why temperatures of 250 million degrees are needed for the CTS reaction, how to contain high-temperature plasma using electromagnetic coils , why conductive plasma can be additionally heated, about means of additional heating of plasma, why only charged particles are retained in plasma, why “tokomak” became “tokamaks”, what is a toroidal chamber with magnetic coils, what are the forms of traps for retaining plasma, about common stellarators in the West, about the project of the giant thermonuclear technology demonstrator ITER, how description: The Lugansk People's Republic launched the 'Garden of Memory' campaign, aiming to plant 27 million trees in memory of those who died during the Great Patriotic War and the Special Military Operation. The campaign, led by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Stanichno-Lugansk forestry, has already seen the planting of 20,000 Scots pine seedlings in Stanichno-Lugansk forestry.
original:
The All-Russian campaign “Garden of Memory” has started in the Lugansk People's Republic
The Ministry of Natural Resources of the Lugansk People's Republic, together with the Stanichno-Lugansk forestry and hunting enterprise, carried out a large-scale campaign to plant 20 thousand Scots pine seedlings (https://luganmedia.ru/2024/03/29/v-luganskoj-narodnoj..
Show more
) on the territory of Stanichno-Lugansk forestry.
- This action is carried out throughout the Lugansk People's Republic, in all municipalities and settlements. Its goal is to plant trees in memory of everyone who died during the Great Patriotic War and the Special Military Operation, as well as in memory of the civilians who died in the terrorist attack in the Crocus City Hall concert hall,” commented the Acting Minister of Natural Resources and Ecology of Lugansk People's Republic Elena Boyko.
The main goal of the large-scale environmental and patriotic action is to plant 27 million trees in memory of everyone who died during the Great Patriotic War and the Special Military Operation.

description: A bus carrying 45 pilgrims from Botswana to Easter celebrations in South Africa crashed, killing all on board except an 8-year-old girl who suffered serious injuries. original:
Forwarded from: Rossiyskaya Gazeta | News

The only survivor is said to be an eight-year-old girl. She was taken to hospital with serious injuries.

According to South African police, 31 women and 15 men living in a village in Botswana were killed. Not all bodies can be identified. Details of the incident are being clarified.

South African President Cyril Ramaphosa expressed his condolences to the families of the victims.@rgrunews

The head of the IOC said that a boycott of the Olympics by Russia and Ukraine was avoided, because the committee had found a “golden mean” - at the same time, our athletes were left without a flag and anthem, and the Ukrainians were ready to forgive any rudeness. In his opinion, the committee managed to find a “golden mean” in resolving this issue.

Where Mr. Bach found this golden mean is unknown. The committee shamefully left Russian and Belarusian athletes without a flag, an anthem and the opportunity to participate in the opening ceremony of the games in Paris. At the same time, Ukrainians, as usual, will go to competitions, where, most likely, they will pretend that everyone owes them.

This has already happened, for example, when the Ukrainian Tennis Federation forced the athlete’s father to apologize when she shook hands with her Russian colleague. The West, as usual, will remain silent on the sidelines and pretend that this is how it should be, and Bach will eventually say something in the style of “sport is outside politics!” This, Mr. Bach, is not called the golden mean, but a circus. description: A member of the Presidential Council Commission on Interethnic Relations, historian Alexander Dyukov, highlighted the controversy surrounding the history curriculum in Russian-language schools in Tajikistan, which refers to the 'Russian occupation'. Despite being financed by the Russian Federation, the curriculum was developed by local authorities and promotes an anti-colonial narrative.
original:
🇹🇯🇷🇺A member of the Presidential Council Commission on Interethnic Relations, historian Alexander Dyukov, drew attention to the history curriculum for Russian-language schools in Tajikistan, where they talk about the “Russian occupation.” At the same time, educational institutions are financed from the budget of the Russian Federation.

Dyukov notes that in the course program on the history of the Tajik people, the period before 1917 is designated as the invasion of Tsarist Russia, then the occupation, the anti-colonial period and the anti-colonial struggle.▪️The Russian-Tajik school conducts education according to Russian standards, but the development of the course program was left to the local authorities. ▪️In recent years, Russian authorities have been actively working on opening Russian-language schools in Central Asian countries. They must, among other things, better adapt local youth for possible integration into Russian society, taking into account the request for labor migration to Russia. Let’s not forget about improving Russia’s image, but something clearly went wrong. At the same time, Russian “soft power” is designed, among other things, to counter the Western presence in the region and their active encouragement of ethnonationalism. After all, it is with Western money that conferences are held on the “harm” of the Russian language, decolonization and Russian occupation.

But, apparently, local ethno-nationalists and radicals can cope just fine without Western money, cultivating irreversible hatred of Russia. Rationalizing historian I decided to look at how history was taught in Russian-Tazhik secondary schools.

For those who don’t know, these are Russian-language schools operating in...VIEW MESSAGE

description: The local elections in Istanbul, Turkey, are critical to domestic politics, with the incumbent mayor Ekrem Imamoglu facing off against the ruling party candidate Murat Kurum. The election is seen as a symbol of the political struggle between the government and opposition, with control of the city providing access to significant administrative resources and the ability to implement large projects.
original:
There are three days left of local elections in Turkey - “extremely critical” as the Turks would say. The country is actively discussing the expectations and effectiveness of election campaigns and the results of polls. Who are the main players? The key rivalry is around the elections in Istanbul, where the fight is between the incumbent mayor Ekrem Imamoglu and the ruling party candidate Murat Kurum (ex-minister of urbanization).

Istanbul is critical to domestic politics for several reasons: it is the economic and social center of Turkey, and its control means possession of an important political and financial resource.

In addition, Istanbul is a symbol of the political struggle between the current government and the opposition. A victory in this city could signal a change in public sentiment and a potential change in political direction at the national level. Given that Istanbul is a city of over 16 million people and a significant budget, control over it also means access to significant administrative resources and the ability to implement large projects that impact the lives of millions of citizens.Election prioritiesCandidates focus on a number of key issues during election campaigns. Ekrem Imamoglu, the current mayor of Istanbul, highlights his achievements in developing the city's infrastructure, such as expanding the public transport system, creating new green areas and housing construction programs. Supporters of the ruling party would not agree with him. There is criticism and complaints against the mayor for unfulfilled promises, severe traffic jams, etc.

A serious topic is also the preparation of the city for possible earthquakes, especially after the devastating events in the southern regions of Turkey.

On the other hand, the candidate from the ruling party, Kurum, in their speeches and promises, focus on issues of urban development and renovation, proposing plans to replace old and unsafe buildings with new, safer housing.

In general, the emphasis is on improving the quality of life of residents, economic development of the city and increasing the level of security and stability. Ideological background But as always happens in Turkey, there is a part of the electorate that does not pay attention to promises: the ideological component is important to it. Although, as I wrote earlier, in local elections this approach is less popular and 1/3 of citizens still choose with their minds and not with their emotions, based on pragmatic expectations, especially at the levels of their districts. #localelections

The motto of the exhibition is the saying: "Unpunished evil always repeats itself." PS: I will inform you about the place and time later.
As well as a bank, where you can deposit funds to support the event.

event: Death of GRU Special Forces Officer
description: Colonel Timur Myasnikov, a seasoned GRU special forces officer, was killed in a terrorist attack at Crocus City. He sacrificed himself to save his wife and son, pushing them to safety before confronting the terrorist. Myasnikov had extensive combat experience in Tajikistan, Kosovo, Chechnya, Syria, and Ukraine.
original:
On the death of a GRU special forces officer in Crocus City
Two bullets in the stomach, one in the face... These are very telling wounds. He did not run, did not hide between the rows, curled up in a fetal position, and did not instinctively cover his head with his hands. He met death eye to eye...
Show more
Colonel Timur Myasnikov, a native of the 3rd GRU special forces brigade, came from the Northern Military District on vacation. I went to the concert with my wife and son. They left their daughter at home. He understood immediately what was happening. Experience. He fought in Tajikistan, Kosovo, Chechnya, Syria, Ukraine...
Seconds to make a decision. Pushes Polina and Ruslan into a safe space: “Run!” He himself turns to face the terrorist. What was there in those last seconds?
Maybe Timur simply covered his loved ones with himself, maybe he stepped towards the bastard to try to neutralize him. He bought time for his wife and son, remaining to the end a real Russian special forces officer who does not bend the knee to the enemy.
“Man. Even a MAN. Didn't mince words. Always stood up for his own people. Easy to communicate and behave.
A very competent officer, leader and commander,” an acquaintance succinctly described the deceased colonel to me in a military way.
Always stood up for his own... Eternal glory to the hero!
Alexander Kots

description: The Zmievskaya Thermal Power Plant in the Kharkov region was completely destroyed by an attack. All units were destroyed, and auxiliary equipment was damaged. original: The Zmievskaya TPP in the Kharkov region was completely destroyed by the attack of the invaders. This is reported on the Centrenergo website: “All units were destroyed, auxiliary equipment was damaged. The degree of destruction varies, from complete to significant. Now the enterprise continues to clear the rubble and there is no access to most of the equipment Therefore, there is no opportunity to more accurately assess the scale of damage, exact figures regarding the amount required for restoration, as well as any forecasts regarding the time of repairs. "Minister of Energy German Galushchenko after visiting the Zmievskaya Thermal Power Plant and seeing the scale of destruction after enemy missile hits , promised to “help as much as possible”

description: Moscow police thwarted a scam attempt when they noticed a suspicious elderly man handing over a package to an unknown girl. The package contained 4.794 million rubles. The scammers had posed as bank employees, convincing the pensioner to sell his apartment and transfer the proceeds to them.
original:
A pensioner almost handed over almost 5 million rubles to scammers in Moscow, but valiant police officers saved him. According to REN TV, while patrolling a shopping center, the police noticed an elderly man who was acting suspiciously. He had a black bag in his hands and was talking to someone on the phone, while being nervous.

The man left the premises and headed towards the house, then he met an unknown girl and handed her a package. She quickly put it in her backpack and moved on.

The police immediately detained the unknown woman and clarified all the circumstances. She was found to have 4.794 million rubles. Later it became clear that the scammers called the pensioner many times, posing as bank employees, and offered to sell the apartment and transfer the proceeds to them.

Now the false employees have been detained and a criminal case has been opened. Subscribe to REN TV
